Pre-Game Insights: Denmark need to win to seal a spot in the round of 16.
A draw could turn out to be enough for Denmark, but they don't expect to rely on that.
Serbia kept their fate in their own hands with a last-gasp equaliser against Slovenia.
The pressure is high for Serbia, but they have shown they can prevail under pressure.
The starting XI for Serbia remains uncertain, with them yet to find the perfect combination.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is between Denmark and Serbia in UEFA EURO 2024 Group C.
The match will be held at the Munich Football Arena on Tuesday 25 June.
The match will kick off at 21:00 CET.
Denmark and Serbia both need to win to have a chance at qualifying.
The countries' previous ten meetings have ended with five wins apiece, but the momentum is very much with the Danes.
Others: Denmark's possible line-up includes Schmeichel, Andersen, Christensen, Vestergaard, Mæhle, Hjulmand, Eriksen, Højbjerg, Bah, Højlund, and Wind.
Serbia's possible line-up includes Rajković, Veljković, Milenković, Pavlović, Birmančević, Ilić, Gudelj, Mladenović, Tadić, Samardžić, and Mitrović.
